news_header: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. faced questioning during his confirmation hearing for US health secretary, addressing his past vaccine skepticism and views on public health.
news_text: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. was questioned by senators at his confirmation hearing for the position of US health secretary. He faced scrutiny over his past comments on vaccines, particularly his skepticism about their safety and efficacy. Kennedy insisted he is not anti-vaccine but advocates for stricter safety studies. He also discussed his views on processed foods, abortion rights, and healthcare access. The hearing was marked by interruptions from protesters and applause for Kennedy's commitment to improving public health. He will face another hearing before the health committee soon.
